intro: Mesembryanthemum pallens subsp. pallens, commonly known as the pale mesembryanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a succulent species characterized by its fleshy, often blue-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its diverse and often ornamental species. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
